careGuide.label: Water Medium
value: To water, fill a bowl with tepid water (unsoftened and filtered of chemicals) for 30 minutes to 1 hour, once a week. Afterward, remove from the bowl and turn upside down to let completely drain on a towel. If the tilly is in bloom, avoid getting the flower wet by propping them out of the water.

careGuide.label: Humidity High
value: Keep these tillies close to a humidifier and mist often to keep humidity high.

careGuide.label: 60째F to 90째F
value: Keep in normal indoor temperatures or mild outdoor temperatures. Bring inside when temperatures dip below 60째F.

careGuide.label: Hardiness Zones 9|10|11|12
value: This plant likes warmer temperatures in bright, indirect light. Bring in when temperatures dip below 60째F.

careGuide.label: Fertilizing Monthly
value: When watering, add 1/4th the recommended dosage of fertilizer to the bowl when soaking. Foliar sprays that are specifically for bromeliads and Tillandsia can be applied. Fertilize monthly from early Spring until October.

careGuide.label: Re-potting Rarely
value: Tillandsia are air plants and grow amongst other plants. Add them to adorn a windowsill or companions with orchids, bromeliads or other plants that enjoy lots of humidity.

careGuide.label: Propagation Cuttings
value: Small tilly pups will originate at the base of an air plant after a bloom cycle. Allow them to grow to at least half the size of the mother plant before removing. In the wild, these plants and pups stay connected as a clump. Removing pups isn't a necessity.

description: The Ionantha Fuego is a small air plant with fuzzy green leaves. When they bloom, they will transform into tones of red to contrast with their purple flowers. These plants are great for terrariums, crafts, and displays on shelves. After blooming, the plant will produce offsets to duplicate the parent plant as they slowly die. This process is a recycling process the air plant goes through to keep growing new plants! Add to a bright, indirect place, water regularly, and keep humidity high. Enjoy the ebb and flow of this plant for generations!
title: Ionantha Fuego Air Plant
